required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Confirming Feeding Tube Position Using CORTRAK
clinical_study.official_title: Confirming Feeding Tube Position Using the CORTRAK Enteral Access System

lead_sponsor.agency: The University of Texas Health Science Center at San Antonio

clinical_study.source: The University of Texas Health Science Center at San Antonio

brief_summary.textblock: This study will compare the accuracy of the CORTRAK enteral access system (CEAS) to x-ray for the determination of feeding tube position within the abdomen.

detailed_description.textblock: In the inpatient pediatric care area (PICU, PCCU, PIMU, ACU), when an x-ray is performed for any reason and a patient has a CORTRAK feeding tube, a provider from the research team will re-insert the small, individualized, flexible stylet back into the patient's feeding tube and document the position of the tube on the CORTRAK display monitor. The x-ray will be obtained by current standard of care and the tube location on x-ray will be compared to the tube location on the CORTRAK monitor. The x-ray will only be obtained as part of the routine care decided by the medical team, the patient will not receive any additional x-rays for this study.

primary_outcome.measure: Confirmation of correct placement of the Feeding tube
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to removal of feeding tube (on average 10-14 days)
primary_outcome.description: An x-ray will be obtained first as per standard of care and within 4 hours of the x-ray, the research procedure will occur. Following slow and careful removal of the stylet, the research team member will ensure there has been no movement of the feeding tube per the depth indicators on the outside of the tube. The location of the tube as it appears on the CORTRAK monitor will be documented and the location of the tube on x-ray will be documented. This will be reported as number of times that the tube is correctly placed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Radiographs required for placement
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to removal of feeding tube (on average 10-14 days)
secondary_outcome.description: Count of radiographs used to ensure correct placement of enteral feeding tube

arm_group.arm_group_label: Feeding Tube Placement using CORTRAK stylet
arm_group.description: Subjects will already have a feeding tube placed and are undergoing X-rays for placement confirmation.
Routine X-ray is used to confirm feeding tube placement

intervention.description: The stylet is a component of the CORTRAK feeding tube system used to confirm the correct placement of the feeding tube
intervention.arm_group_label: Feeding Tube Placement using CORTRAK stylet

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- CORTRAK feeding tube placed as part of clinical care
- Getting xray for any reason
- CORTRAK Stylet available in the room
- Pediatric patients (Aged 17 or younger)
Exclusion Criteria:
-CORTRAK Stylet has been misplaced

overall_official.affiliation: University of Texas Health at San Antonio

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: The University of Texas Health Science Center at San Antonio
